comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The Gov. Bourke statue was moved to its location beside the Mitchell Library in 1925...see comments here re its previous location [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2696670735/]

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Thanks again quasymody! The Mitchell Library holds a lovely Conrad Martens painting of the statue looking down to the Harbour, but without the Library building it is hard to see exactly where it stood. Note the two fig trees planted by State Librarian Ifould. Although beautiful, their huge size has proved a problem to drainage ever since they grew up!
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
